etymologies: Old English (in an earlier sense). Apparently from white + -ing

definitions: In full "whitten-tree". Either of two shrubby trees of the genus Viburnum, the guelder rose, Viburnum opulus, and the wayfaring tree, V. lantana. Now English regional (midlands or historical).
The rowan or mountain ash, Sorbus aucuparia. Compare "whitty". Now English regional (midlands or historical).
